mcqs.question: What is the purpose of the stereo rectification?

options.A: Computation of the fundamental matrix from point correspondences
options.B: Aligns the image planes to make epipolar lines parallel
options.C: Ensures that the fundamental matrix is identity
options.D: Corrects perspective distortions between the stereo pair
options.E: Converts disparity maps directly into depth maps

mcqs.question: What is the effect of using short and long baselines in a stereo system?

options.A: Short: reduced processing time; Long: increased processing time
options.B: Short: good accuracy; Long: improved depth range
options.C: Short: poor accuracy; Long: loss of correspondences
options.D: Short: increased resolution; Long: loss of fine details
options.E: Short: increased disparity; Long: reduced disparity

mcqs.question: What makes stereo matching easier in a simple stereo pair compared to a general image pair?

options.A: Using epipolar geometry to restrict correspondences to a single line
options.B: Using color consistency constraints to match corresponding points
options.C: Using energy minimization to ensure smoothness of the disparities
options.D: Employing a hierarchical block-matching strategy to refine correspondences
options.E: Using direct pixel-based block-matching along horizontal lines

mcqs.question: What happens to disparity in a simple stereo pair as the scene distance increases?

options.A: Disparity oscillates between two fixed values
options.C: Disparity stabilizes at a constant rate

mcqs.question: How does perspective scaling contribute to depth perception?

options.A: Farther objects appear smaller in size
options.D: Objects move faster when farther away
options.E: Parallel lines spread apart on the horizon

mcqs.question: What is the purpose of the epipolar constraint in stereo matching?

options.A: Enables dense stereo matching without rectification
options.B: Reduces the correspondence search along epipolar lines
options.C: Ensures that all points lie within the same epipolar plane
options.D: Enables direct depth computation using the fundamental matrix
options.E: Simplifies the stereo calibration process by making it linear

mcqs.question: Why does block matching fail in textureless regions; how does block size affect the disparity estimation results?

options.A: Matches become ambiguous; small blocks add noise, large blocks lose detail
options.B: No matches are found; small blocks increase precision, large blocks add complexity
options.C: Blocks cannot align; small blocks increase speed, large blocks reduce noise
options.D: Matches are inconsistent; small blocks reduce disparity, large blocks increase computation time
options.E: Due to processing errors; small blocks lose detail, large blocks increase ambiguity

mcqs.question: Why is shape from shading an ambiguous problem, and how can it be solved?

options.A: Single constraint per pixel; solved with normal sharing or smoothness constraints
options.B: Excessive light sources; solved using light source averaging
options.C: Surface variation; solved using multi-light source analysis
options.D: Too many normals per pixel; solved using Gaussian smoothing
options.E: Incomplete pixel constraints; solved using edge detection

mcqs.question: How does energy minimization improve stereo matching?

options.A: It combines data and smoothness terms for coherent disparity maps
options.B: It employs cross-correlation and epipolar geometry to disambiguate the disparities
options.C: It reduces the computational complexity of disparity calculations
options.D: It utilizes disparity extrapolation to disambiguate matches in textureless regions
options.E: It automatically adjusts block sizes based on region characteristics

mcqs.question: How do you determine a 3D location from a point correspondence in a stereo system?

options.A: Perform triangulation using the camera's optical centers and intersecting rays
options.B: Use the disparity in pixel intensity between the images to calculate depth
options.C: Calculate the texture gradient distance between the points to estimate coordinates
options.D: Apply shape from shading analysis on both images to determine depth
options.E: Determine the intersection of the epipolar lines of the corresponding points
